page.title: 14DENTAL HEALTH CARE
page.content: Children's teeth are healthier these days. The number of extractions dropped dramatically with the introduction of fluoride. Poor hygiene, bad diet and sugar foods are the main causes of rotten teeth. Plastic fillings seem to be successful but they have yet to be proved. Eight dentists practises in Dursley, working eight hours a day. Between 18 and 25 patients are treated daily. The assistant's task is to prepare surgery, sterilise the equipment, make appointments, file X-rays, write up reports and lock-up harmful items at the end of the day. Colgate or Crest are recommended as best toothpastes.
